22.notes: The cuda-rt package is version named, you will need to determine which is available for your system.

24.notes: The cuda-rt package is version named, you will need to determine which is available for your system.

38+.notes: The cuda-rt package is version named, you will need to determine which is available for your system.

22.notes:
Ubuntu 22 does not have a system supplied package for eCAL, but it can be installed from the vendor by adding the following repo to your system:
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ecal/ecal-latest -y -u
sudo apt-get update

24.notes:
Ubuntu 24 does not have a system supplied package for eCAL, but it can be installed from the vendor by adding the following repo to your system:
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ecal/ecal-latest -y -u
sudo apt-get update

38+.pkg: graphviz hdf5-devel libcurl-devel qwt-qt5-devel qt5-qtbase-devel libyaml-devel zlib-devel openssl-devel

38+.notes: Fedora does not supply libuvc from its repositories. You will need to install it from https://github.com/libuvc/libuvc.
Fedora does not supply libuvc from its repositories. You will need to install it from https://github.com/libuvc/libuvc.

22.pkg: qemu qemu-system qemu-system-data qeum-utils qemu-user libqcow-dev libqcow-utils

24.pkg: qemu qemu-system qemu-system-data qeum-utils qemu-user libqcow-dev libqcow-utils

22.notes:
Ubuntu does not have a system supplied package for librealsense, but it can be installed from the vendor (Intel) by adding the following repo to your system:
sudo apt-get -y install curl apt-transport-https lsb-core
sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings
curl -sSf https://librealsense.intel.com/Debian/librealsense.pgp | sudo tee /etc/apt/keyrings/librealsense.pgp > /dev/null
echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/librealsense.pgp] https://librealsense.intel.com/Debian/apt-repo `lsb_release -cs` main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/librealsense.list > /dev/null
sudo apt-get update

24.notes:
Ubuntu does not have a system supplied package for librealsense, but it can be installed from the vendor (Intel) by adding the following repo to your system:
sudo apt-get -y install curl apt-transport-https lsb-core
sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings
curl -sSf https://librealsense.intel.com/Debian/librealsense.pgp | sudo tee /etc/apt/keyrings/librealsense.pgp > /dev/null
echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/librealsense.pgp] https://librealsense.intel.com/Debian/apt-repo `lsb_release -cs` main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/librealsense.list > /dev/null
sudo apt-get update

22.notes: ZED SDK (version 3) is required for the zed plugin. It must be installed manually. See here for details. It also requires some CUDA packages which should be available here or through your Ubuntu repo.

24.notes: ZED SDK (version 3) is required for the zed plugin. As of this release there is no ZED SDK available for Ubuntu 24, and the versions for Ubuntu 22 will not work. Once it is available, you can install it manually. See here for details. It also requires some CUDA packages which should be available here or through your Ubuntu repo.
